tool_description: Retrieve data about the airports of the world based on code, location or search.
name: Airports
title: Airports

api_list.name: Search
api_list.description: Search for airports with a string eg "heathrow"

api_list.name: Airport
api_list.description: Collect airport info by code - eg LAX, LHR etc - the response is the same format as the other APIs so the data key will generally have one item if the code exists or it will be an empty array if the code isn't valid.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://airports12.p.rapidapi.com/airport/LAX"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "airports12.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://airports12.p.rapidapi.com/airport/{code}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "airports12.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Closest
api_list.description: Returns the closest 12 airports by location.  Includes a distance param for each returned airport in metres.
